intro: Trichopilia marginata, commonly known as the marginate trichopilia, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a marginal fringe, giving it a distinctive appearance. Trichopilia marginata is typically found in open habitats such as grasslands and along coastal areas.
